title: Free Book 2/9 - 2/11:  Lobster Tales: Stories of Lives Transformed by the Work of Jordan Peterson
description:
Scroll down for a link to a free book by Annette Poizner, founder of Lobster University Press and author of 7 books about Jordan Peterson's ideas, who joins me to discuss the travesty of the Times article and offers 3 new lenses through which to view Jordan Peterson's struggles. Annette discusses the book in the last five minutes of the video.

Directions Decca Aitkenhead could have taken in the Times article, but didn't:

The attributes of genius: open to experience, driven/idealistic, surprisingly humble, individualistic/rebellious/dislikes authority.

The contrast between Rachel (the outer, revealed world) v.
Leah (the inner world of thought) - the archetype of the hated one.

The loss of balance in yin (cool, rest) and yang (heat, restless).

By not focusing on the work Jordan Peterson has done to help people, Aitkenhead lost the opportunity to bring light into the world by making sense of Jordan's story.

The book is available for free download from 2/9 through 2/11/21, and as the book is updated, your version will be updated as well.  
Lobster Tales: Stories of Lives Transformed by the Work of Jordan Peterson
https://amzn.to/37cV7NJ
Lobster University Press

Lobster University Press | apoizner (wixsite.com)

A blogpost about the Rachel and Leah story:
https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/mary-rhoda-grace-frankie-rachel-leah-understanding-bffs/
